body: @chenfucn please help take a look.  It is related to PR #8178.
Hi, any update on this issue?

I can reproduce the error.
```
/data/bt/src/toolchain/gcc-arm-10.3-2021.07-x86_64-aarch64-none-linux-gnu/bin/../lib/gcc/aarch64-none-linux-gnu/10.3.1/../../../../aarch64-none-linux-gnu/bin/ld: libonnxruntime_common.a(cpuid_info.cc.o): in function `cpuinfo_has_arm_neon_dot':
/data/bt/src/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/include/cpuinfo.h:1718: undefined reference to `cpuinfo_isa'
/data/bt/src/toolchain/gcc-arm-10.3-2021.07-x86_64-aarch64-none-linux-gnu/bin/../lib/gcc/aarch64-none-linux-gnu/10.3.1/../../../../aarch64-none-linux-gnu/bin/ld: /data/bt/src/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/include/cpuinfo.h:1718: undefined reference to `cpuinfo_isa'
/data/bt/src/toolchain/gcc-arm-10.3-2021.07-x86_64-aarch64-none-linux-gnu/bin/../lib/gcc/aarch64-none-linux-gnu/10.3.1/../../../../aarch64-none-linux-gnu/bin/ld: external/pytorch_cpuinfo/libcpuinfo.a(init.c.o): in function `cpuinfo_initialize':
/data/bt/src/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/init.c:37: undefined reference to `cpuinfo_arm_linux_init'
/data/bt/src/toolchain/gcc-arm-10.3-2021.07-x86_64-aarch64-none-linux-gnu/bin/../lib/gcc/aarch64-none-linux-gnu/10.3.1/../../../../aarch64-none-linux-gnu/bin/ld: /data/bt/src/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/init.c:37: undefined reference to `cpuinfo_arm_linux_init'
/data/bt/src/toolchain/gcc-arm-10.3-2021.07-x86_64-aarch64-none-linux-gnu/bin/../lib/gcc/aarch64-none-linux-gnu/10.3.1/../../../../aarch64-none-linux-gnu/bin/ld: onnxruntime_mlas_test: hidden symbol `cpuinfo_arm_linux_init' isn't defined
/data/bt/src/toolchain/gcc-arm-10.3-2021.07-x86_64-aarch64-none-linux-gnu/bin/../lib/gcc/aarch64-none-linux-gnu/10.3.1/../../../../aarch64-none-linux-gnu/bin/ld: final link failed: bad value
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
make[2]: *** [CMakeFiles/onnxruntime_mlas_test.dir/build.make:366: onnxruntime_mlas_test] Error 1
make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/Makefile2:1397: CMakeFiles/onnxruntime_mlas_test.dir/all] Error 2
make[1]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
```
Hi @coltonpeltierSE, I'm updating the build instructions in #8710. Could you please help me take a look?

The error is because: After pytorch cpuinfo was introduced to onnx runtime, the following line is needed in toolchain.cmake:
```
SET(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR aarch64)
```

Hi,

Thank you for looking into this. I've updated my tool.cmake with the following change:

`
SET(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR aarch64)
`

Now when I perform make I get the following errors:
`
[  1%] Building C object external/pytorch_cpuinfo/CMakeFiles/cpuinfo.dir/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c.o
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c: In function 'cpuinfo_arm64_linux_decode_isa_from_proc_cpuinfo':
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:14:17: error: 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_AES' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE2_AES'?
  if (features & CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_AES) {
                 ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                 CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE2_AES
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:14:17: note: each undeclared identifier is reported only once for each function it appears in

                 CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE2_PMULL
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:20:17: error: 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_SHA1' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE2_SHA1'?

                 ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                 CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE2_SHA1
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:23:17: error: 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_SHA2' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE2_SHA2'?
  if (features & CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_SHA2) {
                 ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                 CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE2_SHA2
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:26:17: error: 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_CRC32' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE2_CRC32'?
  if (features & CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_CRC32) {
                 ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                 CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE2_CRC32
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:29:17: error: 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_ATOMICS' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_TLS'?
  if (features & CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_ATOMICS) {
                 ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                 CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_TLS
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:30:6: error: 'struct cpuinfo_arm_isa' has no member named 'atomics'
   isa->atomics = true;
      ^~
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:49:35: error: 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_FPHP' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_FPA'?
   const uint32_t fp16arith_mask = CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_FPHP | CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_ASIMDHP;
                                   ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                                   CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_FPA
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:49:68: error: 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_ASIMDHP' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_SWP'?
   const uint32_t fp16arith_mask = CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_FPHP | CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_ASIMDHP;
                                                                    ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                                                                    CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_SWP
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:75:20: error: 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_ASIMDRDM' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_IDIVA'?

                    ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                    CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_IDIVA
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:107:19: error: 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_ASIMDDP' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_SWP'?
    if (features & CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_ASIMDDP) {
                   ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                   CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_SWP
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:112:17: error: 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_JSCVT' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_JAVA'?
  if (features & CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_JSCVT) {
                 ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                 CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_JAVA
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:118:17: error: 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_FCMA' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_FPA'?

                 ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                 CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_FPA
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:121:17: error: 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_SVE' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_SWP'?
  if (features & CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_SVE) {
                 ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                 CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE_SWP
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:122:6: error: 'struct cpuinfo_arm_isa' has no member named 'sve'
   isa->sve = true;
      ^~
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c:124:18: error: 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE2_SVE2' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE2_SHA2'?
  if (features2 & CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE2_SVE2) {
                  ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                  CPUINFO_ARM_LINUX_FEATURE2_SHA2

   isa->sve2 = true;
        ^~~~
        sha2
external/pytorch_cpuinfo/CMakeFiles/cpuinfo.dir/build.make:229: recipe for target 'external/pytorch_cpuinfo/CMakeFiles/cpuinfo.dir/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c.o' failed
make[2]: *** [external/pytorch_cpuinfo/CMakeFiles/cpuinfo.dir/src/arm/linux/aarch64-isa.c.o] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:2015: recipe for target 'external/pytorch_cpuinfo/CMakeFiles/cpuinfo.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [external/pytorch_cpuinfo/CMakeFiles/cpuinfo.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:165: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2
`

```
SET(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR arm)
```

You are doing it for arm 32, not 64.

That's the same value for `CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR` I had in my original post, setting it back to `SET(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR arm)` reproduces the error from my original post:

```
[ 17%] Linking CXX executable onnxruntime_mlas_test
/root/sdk/mp/sysroots/x86_64-galaxysdk-linux/usr/libexec/arm-galaxy-linux-gnueabi/gcc/arm-galaxy-linux-gnueabi/8.3.0/real-ld: libonnxruntime_common.a(cpuid_info.cc.o): in function `__gnu_cxx::new_allocator<char>::~new_allocator()':
/root/sdk/mp/sysroots/armv7vet2hf-vfpv4d16-galaxy-linux-gnueabi/usr/include/c++/8.3.0/ext/new_allocator.h:86: undefined reference to `cpuinfo_isa'
/root/sdk/mp/sysroots/x86_64-galaxysdk-linux/usr/libexec/arm-galaxy-linux-gnueabi/gcc/arm-galaxy-linux-gnueabi/8.3.0/real-ld: external/pytorch_cpuinfo/libcpuinfo.a(init.c.o): in function `cpuinfo_initialize':
/home/onnxruntime/onnxruntime/cmake/external/pytorch_cpuinfo/src/init.c:56: undefined reference to `cpuinfo_arm_linux_init'
/root/sdk/mp/sysroots/x86_64-galaxysdk-linux/usr/libexec/arm-galaxy-linux-gnueabi/gcc/arm-galaxy-linux-gnueabi/8.3.0/real-ld: onnxruntime_mlas_test: hidden symbol `cpuinfo_arm_linux_init' isn't defined
/root/sdk/mp/sysroots/x86_64-galaxysdk-linux/usr/libexec/arm-galaxy-linux-gnueabi/gcc/arm-galaxy-linux-gnueabi/8.3.0/real-ld: final link failed: bad value
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
CMakeFiles/onnxruntime_mlas_test.dir/build.make:376: recipe for target 'onnxruntime_mlas_test' failed
make[2]: *** [onnxruntime_mlas_test] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:429: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/onnxruntime_mlas_test.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/onnxruntime_mlas_test.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:165: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2
```


 Here's my full `tool.cmake` file:

```
SET(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME Linux)
SET(CMAKE_SYSTEM_VERSION 1)
SET(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR arm)
SET(CMAKE_C_COMPILER arm-galaxy-linux-gnueabi-gcc -march=armv7ve -mthumb -mfpu=vfpv4-d16 -mfloat-abi=hard --sysroot=/root/sdk/mp/sysroots/armv7vet2hf-vfpv4d16-galaxy-linux-gnueabi)
SET(CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER arm-galaxy-linux-gnueabi-g++ -march=armv7ve -mthumb -mfpu=vfpv4-d16 -mfloat-abi=hard --sysroot=/root/sdk/mp/sysroots/armv7vet2hf-vfpv4d16-galaxy-linux-gnueabi)
SET(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_PROGRAM NEVER)
SET(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_LIBRARY ONLY)
SET(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_INCLUDE ONLY)
SET(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_PACKAGE ONLY)
SET(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH /root/sdk/mp/sysroots/armv7vet2hf-vfpv4d16-galaxy-linux-gnueabi/;/root/sdk/mp/sysroots/armv7vet2hf-vfpv4d16-galaxy-linux-gnueabi/lib/)
```
That did the trick, looks like `armv7` was what I needed instead of just `arm`. Thank you for the help. It could be useful in your updated instructions to highlight this.
when i build android armv8a has follow error for 1.10 code:

> See: https://github.com/pytorch/cpuinfo/blob/866ae6e5ffe93a1f63be738078da94cf3005cce2/CMakeLists.txt#L159
> 
> try
> 
> ```
> SET(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR armv7)
> ```

This helped me a lot. The documentation on [onnxruntime.ai](https://onnxruntime.ai/docs/build/inferencing.html#cross-compiling-on-linux) does not mention this. Perhaps the addition of the `SET(CMAKE_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR arm)` line can be added to the instructions  as well.
